required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Optimize RV Follow-up Selective Site Pacing Clinical Trial
clinical_study.official_title: Optimize RV Follow-up Selective Site Pacing Clinical Trial

lead_sponsor.agency: Medtronic Cardiac Rhythm and Heart Failure

clinical_study.source: Medtronic Cardiac Rhythm and Heart Failure

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of the Optimize RV Follow-Up study is to determine the long-term effect of selective site pacing. Selective site pacing refers to which area of the right ventricle the lead is placed. The goal of selective site pacing is to improve how the heart contracts when paced.

detailed_description.textblock: The Optimize RV Follow-Up Selective Site Pacing Clinical Trial is open to subjects that were previously enrolled in the Optimize RV Selective Site Pacing Clinical Trial.

primary_outcome.measure: Difference in Mean Left Ventricular Ejection Fraction (LVEF) Between RV Pacing Sites at 24 Month
primary_outcome.description: Difference in mean LVEF between pacing sites (RV mid-septal minus RV apex) at 24 months using the 4 chamber view

secondary_outcome.measure: Compare the Change in LVEF From the 2 Week Visit (Collected in Prior Study) to the 24 Month Follow-up Visit Between the Optimize RV Mid-Septum Pacing (RVS) Group and RV Apical Pacing (RVA) Group.
secondary_outcome.description: Compare the change in LVEF (in the 4 chamber view) from 2 weeks to 24 months between the Optimize RV Mid-Septum Pacing (RVS) group and RV Apical Pacing (RVA) group.

secondary_outcome.measure: Compare Change in LV End Systolic Volume After 24 Months Follow-up Between the Optimize RVS Group and RVA Group.
secondary_outcome.description: Compare change in 4 chamber LV end systolic volume between baseline and 24 month visit between the Optimize RVS group and RVA group.

secondary_outcome.measure: Compare AT/AF Burden From Baseline to 24 Months Follow-up Between the Optimize RV Mid-Septal (RVS) and RV Apex (RVA) Groups.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Whole time from baseline to 24 months averaged by day
secondary_outcome.description: Test the difference in AT/AF burden (defined as total duration of minutes in AT or AF relative to total patient follow-up days from baseline to 24 months follow-up) between the Optimize RVS and RVA groups. The proportion can be interpreted as the average time per day that patieents were in AT/AF as collected in the time period from baseline to 24 month follow-up.

arm_group.description: Pacing lead located in the right ventricle at the middle of the muscle separating the right and left sides of the heart
Pacing lead located at the bottom of the right ventricle of the heart, in the right ventricular apex

intervention.description: A Medtronic or Vitatron market-approved dual-chamber implantable pulse generator (IPG) with atrial tachycardia/atrial fibrillation (AT/AF) trending ability
Medtronic market-approved SelectSecure Model 3830 bipolar pacing lead

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Subjects enrolled in the Optimize RV study (version 3, dated 6 March 2007)
- Subjects or legal guardians who are willing and able to sign an Informed Consent (and Authorization to use and Disclose Health Information Form, if applicable)
Exclusion Criteria:
- Subjects who have a device that was programmed outside the Optimize RV programming requirements
- Subjects implanted with and implantable cardioverter-defibrillator (ICD) or cardiac resynchronization therapy (CRT) device
- Subjects who are pregnant or nursing

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Study was open to subjects that were previously enrolled in the original randomized Optimize RV Selective Site Pacing Clnical Trial (ORV)(NCT00422669) who consented between October 2009 through April 2011
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Two of 67 subjects were excluded due to non-compliant programming.

group.title: RV Apical Pacing
group.description: Pacing lead located at the bottom of the right ventricle of the heart, in the right ventricular apex Medtronic or Vitatron Dual-Chamber Pacemaker : A Medtronic or Vitatron market-approved dual-chamber implantable pulse generator (IPG) with atrial tachycardia/atrial fibrillation (AT/AF) trending ability Medtronic SelectSecure 3830 Lead : Medtronic market-approved SelectSecure Model 3830 bipolar pacing lead

group.title: RV Mid-Septal Pacing
group.description: Pacing lead located in the right ventricle at the middle of the muscle separating the right and left sides of the heart Medtronic or Vitatron Dual-Chamber Pacemaker : A Medtronic or Vitatron market-approved dual-chamber implantable pulse generator (IPG) with atrial tachycardia/atrial fibrillation (AT/AF) trending ability Medtronic SelectSecure 3830 Lead : Medtronic market-approved SelectSecure Model 3830 bipolar pacing lead

group.title: RV Apical Pacing
group.description: Pacing lead located at the bottom of the right ventricle of the heart, in the right ventricular apex Medtronic or Vitatron Dual-Chamber Pacemaker : A Medtronic or Vitatron market-approved dual-chamber implantable pulse generator (IPG) with atrial tachycardia/atrial fibrillation (AT/AF) trending ability Medtronic SelectSecure 3830 Lead : Medtronic market-approved SelectSecure Model 3830 bipolar pacing lead

group.title: RV Mid-Septal Pacing
group.description: Pacing lead located in the right ventricle at the middle of the muscle separating the right and left sides of the heart Medtronic or Vitatron Dual-Chamber Pacemaker : A Medtronic or Vitatron market-approved dual-chamber implantable pulse generator (IPG) with atrial tachycardia/atrial fibrillation (AT/AF) trending ability Medtronic SelectSecure 3830 Lead : Medtronic market-approved SelectSecure Model 3830 bipolar pacing lead

category.title: Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander

outcome.title: Difference in Mean Left Ventricular Ejection Fraction (LVEF) Between RV Pacing Sites at 24 Month
outcome.description: Difference in mean LVEF between pacing sites (RV mid-septal minus RV apex) at 24 months using the 4 chamber view
outcome.population: Subjects who had LVEF measurements from both baseline and 24 month timepoints

group.title: RV Apical Pacing
group.description: Pacing lead located at the bottom of the right ventricle of the heart, in the right ventricular apex Medtronic or Vitatron Dual-Chamber Pacemaker : A Medtronic or Vitatron market-approved dual-chamber implantable pulse generator (IPG) with atrial tachycardia/atrial fibrillation (AT/AF) trending ability Medtronic SelectSecure 3830 Lead : Medtronic market-approved SelectSecure Model 3830 bipolar pacing lead

group.title: RV Mid-Septal Pacing
group.description: Pacing lead located in the right ventricle at the middle of the muscle separating the right and left sides of the heart Medtronic or Vitatron Dual-Chamber Pacemaker : A Medtronic or Vitatron market-approved dual-chamber implantable pulse generator (IPG) with atrial tachycardia/atrial fibrillation (AT/AF) trending ability Medtronic SelectSecure 3830 Lead : Medtronic market-approved SelectSecure Model 3830 bipolar pacing lead

measure.title: Difference in Mean Left Ventricular Ejection Fraction (LVEF) Between RV Pacing Sites at 24 Month
measure.description: Difference in mean LVEF between pacing sites (RV mid-septal minus RV apex) at 24 months using the 4 chamber view
measure.population: Subjects who had LVEF measurements from both baseline and 24 month timepoints

analysis.groups_desc: HO: Pacing at selective RV sites (mid-septum or apex) has no different impact on the change in LVEF after 24 months follow-up. With 12% SD and 80 subjects in groups will have 90% power to detect an absolute difference in LVEF of 6.2% at 24 months follow-up at an alpha level of 0.05.

outcome.title: Compare the Change in LVEF From the 2 Week Visit (Collected in Prior Study) to the 24 Month Follow-up Visit Between the Optimize RV Mid-Septum Pacing (RVS) Group and RV Apical Pacing (RVA) Group.
outcome.description: Compare the change in LVEF (in the 4 chamber view) from 2 weeks to 24 months between the Optimize RV Mid-Septum Pacing (RVS) group and RV Apical Pacing (RVA) group.
outcome.population: Patients that had both 2 week and 24 month follow-up echo data with a 4 chamber LVEF measurement

group.title: RV Apical Pacing
group.description: Pacing lead located at the bottom of the right ventricle of the heart, in the right ventricular apex Medtronic or Vitatron Dual-Chamber Pacemaker : A Medtronic or Vitatron market-approved dual-chamber implantable pulse generator (IPG) with atrial tachycardia/atrial fibrillation (AT/AF) trending ability Medtronic SelectSecure 3830 Lead : Medtronic market-approved SelectSecure Model 3830 bipolar pacing lead

group.title: RV Mid-Septal Pacing
group.description: Pacing lead located in the right ventricle at the middle of the muscle separating the right and left sides of the heart Medtronic or Vitatron Dual-Chamber Pacemaker : A Medtronic or Vitatron market-approved dual-chamber implantable pulse generator (IPG) with atrial tachycardia/atrial fibrillation (AT/AF) trending ability Medtronic SelectSecure 3830 Lead : Medtronic market-approved SelectSecure Model 3830 bipolar pacing lead

measure.title: Compare the Change in LVEF From the 2 Week Visit (Collected in Prior Study) to the 24 Month Follow-up Visit Between the Optimize RV Mid-Septum Pacing (RVS) Group and RV Apical Pacing (RVA) Group.
measure.description: Compare the change in LVEF (in the 4 chamber view) from 2 weeks to 24 months between the Optimize RV Mid-Septum Pacing (RVS) group and RV Apical Pacing (RVA) group.
measure.population: Patients that had both 2 week and 24 month follow-up echo data with a 4 chamber LVEF measurement

analysis.groups_desc: Ho: Packing at selective RV sites (mid-Septum or apex) has no different impact on LVEF change from 2 weeks to 24 months.

outcome.title: Compare Change in LV End Systolic Volume After 24 Months Follow-up Between the Optimize RVS Group and RVA Group.
outcome.description: Compare change in 4 chamber LV end systolic volume between baseline and 24 month visit between the Optimize RVS group and RVA group.
outcome.population: All subjects who had 4 chamber LV end systolic volume at both the baseline and the 24 month time points

group.title: RV Apical Pacing
group.description: Pacing lead located at the bottom of the right ventricle of the heart, in the right ventricular apex Medtronic or Vitatron Dual-Chamber Pacemaker : A Medtronic or Vitatron market-approved dual-chamber implantable pulse generator (IPG) with atrial tachycardia/atrial fibrillation (AT/AF) trending ability Medtronic SelectSecure 3830 Lead : Medtronic market-approved SelectSecure Model 3830 bipolar pacing lead

group.title: RV Mid-Septal Pacing
group.description: Pacing lead located in the right ventricle at the middle of the muscle separating the right and left sides of the heart Medtronic or Vitatron Dual-Chamber Pacemaker : A Medtronic or Vitatron market-approved dual-chamber implantable pulse generator (IPG) with atrial tachycardia/atrial fibrillation (AT/AF) trending ability Medtronic SelectSecure 3830 Lead : Medtronic market-approved SelectSecure Model 3830 bipolar pacing lead

measure.title: Compare Change in LV End Systolic Volume After 24 Months Follow-up Between the Optimize RVS Group and RVA Group.
measure.description: Compare change in 4 chamber LV end systolic volume between baseline and 24 month visit between the Optimize RVS group and RVA group.
measure.population: All subjects who had 4 chamber LV end systolic volume at both the baseline and the 24 month time points

analysis.groups_desc: Ho: Pacing at selective sites (RVS or RVA) has no different impact on LV end systolic volume

outcome.title: Compare AT/AF Burden From Baseline to 24 Months Follow-up Between the Optimize RV Mid-Septal (RVS) and RV Apex (RVA) Groups.
outcome.description: Test the difference in AT/AF burden (defined as total duration of minutes in AT or AF relative to total patient follow-up days from baseline to 24 months follow-up) between the Optimize RVS and RVA groups. The proportion can be interpreted as the average time per day that patieents were in AT/AF as collected in the time period from baseline to 24 month follow-up.
outcome.time_frame: Whole time from baseline to 24 months averaged by day
outcome.population: All subjects who meet inclusion/exclusion criteria for the study.

group.title: RV Apical Pacing
group.description: Pacing lead located at the bottom of the right ventricle of the heart, in the right ventricular apex Medtronic or Vitatron Dual-Chamber Pacemaker : A Medtronic or Vitatron market-approved dual-chamber implantable pulse generator (IPG) with atrial tachycardia/atrial fibrillation (AT/AF) trending ability Medtronic SelectSecure 3830 Lead : Medtronic market-approved SelectSecure Model 3830 bipolar pacing lead

group.title: RV Mid-Septal Pacing
group.description: Pacing lead located in the right ventricle at the middle of the muscle separating the right and left sides of the heart Medtronic or Vitatron Dual-Chamber Pacemaker : A Medtronic or Vitatron market-approved dual-chamber implantable pulse generator (IPG) with atrial tachycardia/atrial fibrillation (AT/AF) trending ability Medtronic SelectSecure 3830 Lead : Medtronic market-approved SelectSecure Model 3830 bipolar pacing lead

measure.title: Compare AT/AF Burden From Baseline to 24 Months Follow-up Between the Optimize RV Mid-Septal (RVS) and RV Apex (RVA) Groups.
measure.description: Test the difference in AT/AF burden (defined as total duration of minutes in AT or AF relative to total patient follow-up days from baseline to 24 months follow-up) between the Optimize RVS and RVA groups. The proportion can be interpreted as the average time per day that patieents were in AT/AF as collected in the time period from baseline to 24 month follow-up.
measure.population: All subjects who meet inclusion/exclusion criteria for the study.

analysis.groups_desc: Ho: The AT/AF burden in the RVS group is the same as the RVA group.

reported_events.desc: The collection of adverse events and subject deaths was not required to meet the objectives of this study and thus was not performed. The products are market approved and used within labeling. Any alleged device related deaths, serious injury, compliants, event would be reported not to this study but via Medical Device Reporting.

group.title: No Subjects
group.description: No subjects had adverse events or death collected as part of this study.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The only disclosure restriction on the PI is that the sponsor can review results communications prior to public release and can embargo communications regarding trial results for a period that is less than or equal to 60 days. The sponsor cannot require changes to the communication and cannot extend the embargo.

clinical_results.limitations_and_caveats: Since the enrollment goal of the study (n=160) was not met (it was decided to stop enrollments after 67 due to slow enrollments), the results of the study were not powered and the results for the primary objective are inconclusive at this time.
